title: For Sale:  Winchester M1 Garand 1944 100% CORRECT NICE!
postcontent: Winchester M1 Garand made in October 1944. Rifle is 100% re-stored to a CORRECT Oct. 1944 WRA Garand with original barrel and receiver set that has been re-parkerized. Serial # 2510201. No front sight or hand guard rattle and locks up tight. Barrel is WP proof marked with a 10 on side under Op. Rod and has WRA markings on top under hand guard. T.E. is 2.5. and is not chromed at gas port. Bright and shiny bore with no pitting. Rear sight knobs are knurled and have open arrows. Thick aperture. WRA sight base with rough milling marks. Long pinion with type II lock bar. Trigger housing clover leaf and marked D28290-WRA. Trigger guard marked C46025 WRA. Trigger is un-marked. Hammer C46008-1WRA. Safety WRA-1. Guide with wings. Bolt marked D28287-1 WRA. Wide base gas cylinder with round top. Solid lock screw. Bullet guide milled and un-marked with punch proof mark. Single bevel follower arm. Type II Follower is un-marked with punch proof mark. Type II Op. Rod catch. Follower rod A marked short and milled. Lower band is arched with rough milling marks. Round front clip latch marked A on inside. WRA Slant Op. rod is un-cut and marked D35382-WRA. Front sight is 7/8 inches wide and punch proof marked. Stock is WRA and is short channel and lightly sanded with no cartouche but has P proof mark at heel and distinctive V in trigger housing area. Matching walnut handguards and rear handguard has small crack near clip on top. See picture #27. Hardly noticeable, but, there. Buttplate is marked 2S on inside. Many hard to find and expensive parts on this rifle. My reserve is what I paid for the rifle in 2001. Finish on these parts have very uniform wear with different slight shades of parkerizing and match Great!! Beautiful Winchester!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ruger 5909 SR-556 68 Rifle in 6.8mm
postcontent:
Packag comes with  one five-round magazine and two twenty-five round magazines, the SR-556/6.8 is an ideal hunting rifle for those who appreciate the versatility of the customizable and ergonomic AR-style platform. The 6.8 SPC has ample power for hunting medium-sized game, and the greater muzzle and downrange energy enhances the capability of the SR-556 in defensive or tactical roles as well.

The SR-556/6.8 retains all the features of the original SR-556 that make it an outstanding value in the AR-style rifles. The patent-pending, two-stage piston delivers a smooth power stroke to the one-piece bolt carrier, which softens recoil, aiding both shooter comfort and durability of the rifle. The four-position gas regulator allows the shooter to tune the rifle to the ammunition being fired and environmental conditions present. A chrome-lined, cold hammer forged barrel provides accuracy and longevity, Troy Industries Folding Battlesights™, Quad Rail and rail covers add considerable value to the package, as does the Hogue® Monogrip®, six-position stock, sight adjustment tool, and the padded carry case, all included with the SR-556/6.8.

title: For Sale:  MR Baby Eagle II 9 mm NIB
postcontent:
The “Baby” of the Desert Eagle family offers an excellent handgun value and plenty of firepower. The grip design is exceptionally comfortable and well liked by shooters. Since 2008 the Baby Desert Eagle was no longer imported into the US, however beginning again in 2011 with the acquisition of Magnum Research by Kahr Arms we are excited to bring this popular firearm back to the US market. 
Trigger action of the Baby Desert Eagle pistol is double action/single action (DA/SA) and is available in three popular calibers (9mm, .40 S&W, .45 ACP) and several barrel lengths. The Baby Desert Eagle pistol is available in either a steel frame or a polymer frame with a black finish. The steel frames and slides are produced from high quality carbon steel with an attractive matte black oxide finish. Full size and semi-compact models feature a tactical rail for optional lasers and/or flashlights. All models come with a slide mounted decocking safety with dual levers and upgraded fixed combat sights with three white dots. The rear sight is well designed in appearance and is snag free.   It is a CAI-made Polisher underfolder, US made receiver and barrel.  I know, that ain't great.  AND...the front trunnion is installed crooked. (see below picture).  It looks bad but it has not affected function once, and there is NO extra wear marks from it and is actually about as smooth an action as I've had.

The PLUS is that it is extremely accurate.  Do a google search even, this run of Polish Underfolders were made with REALLY tight barrels, with brown bear this thing was turning in .75" groups at 50 yards.

  So there it is, the downside, plus the plus side.   I am wanting this to move, I believe the plus of good accuracy outweights the bad.     Parts count is:
 Receiver
Barrel
Trigger group (3).
Pistol grip.
 Slant Break.
  With a US barrel, receiver and trigger group, you can slap on almost any type of surplus furniture as long as the PG or muzzle is US made.

Price is $500 and includes a magazine

title: For Sale:  POLICE TASER M18L WITH LASER LIKE NEW
location: RIO RANCHO NEW MEXICO 87144, Albuquerque, New Mexico
postcontent:
The Advanced Taser M-18 series has almost 100% effectiveness rating. It combines the injury reducing benefits of traditional stun technology with a quantum leap in stopping power via new Electro-Muscular Disruption (EMD) technology. In police studies, the new Advanced Taser has a higher instant incapacitation rate than a 9mm hand gun. The Advanced Taser shoots out 2 darts attached to 15 feet of wire. 50,000 volts travels over the wires and over-rides the central nervous system providing incredible takedown power.

NEW Electro-Muscular Disruption (EMD) Technology
There are two categories of energy weapons: Stun weapons and EMD weapons. 
STUN WEAPONS: Traditional stun technology weapons operate in a 7-14 Watt range and interfere with the communication signals within the nervous system of the target. These stun systems primarily effect the sensory nervous system. Like static on the communication lines between the brain and the body, stun systems interfere with the human command and control systems. However, a small percentage of people with a very high tolerance for electrical stimulation can fight through the effect of these 7-14 Watt systems. The AIR TASER 44000 series is a stun weapon using the same settings used by law enforcement for over 20 years. 
EMD WEAPONS: EMD weapons use a more powerful 18 to 26 Watt electrical signal to completely override the central nervous system and directly control the skeletal muscles. This EMD effect causes an uncontrollable contraction of the muscle tissue, allowing the M-Series to physically debilitate a target regardless of pain tolerance or mental focus. The ADVANCED TASER M-Series are EMD weapons -- specifically designed to stop even the most elite, aggressive, focused combatants. Rather than simply interfering with communication between the brain and muscles, the ADVANCED TASER EMD systems directly tell the muscles what to do: contract until the target is in the fetal position on the ground. The ADVANCED TASER provides for maximum safety for both the officer and the subject by bringing dangerous situations quickly under control before force escalates to lethal levels. MSRP OVER $500.


$450.00 OBO.


Just been sitting in safe un-fired... Time to find it a new home.Comes with 4 NEW Cartridges and spare battery pack. 

7174254777

title: For Sale:  Ruger SR9c compact (3314), Best Outo-Of-Box striker-fired trigger (retails for $530)
postcontent:
NO TRADES OR ADDITIONAL DISCOUNTS!
 New, In Box! The Ruger SR9 series (and the FNS 9 Series) are reputed to have the nest out-of-the-box triggers in the industry. An excellent trigger is key to accurate first and follow-up shots. 

The SR9c compact pistol weighs in at 23.40 oz. and features an overall length of 6.85", a height of 4.61", and the same slim 1.27" grip width (across safety levers) as the full-sized SR9. It comes with two magazines that provide options in both capacity and grip size. The standard magazine holds 10 rounds and features a flat bottom butt plate; a finger grip extension floor plate is also included. The second magazine features a grip adapter and holds 17 rounds, instantly transforming the smaller, compact grip into a full-sized 9mm grip. The 3.50" barreled pistol features an integral accessory rail that accommodates most lights and lasers.

The SR9c compact pistol utilizes the same adjustable, high-visibility 3-Dot sight system as its full-sized predecessor, setting it apart from many compact pistols that rely on fixed sights. New serrations are located on the front portion of the slide, making it easier to both manipulate the slide and to press check the chamber. The SR9c is available with a glass-filled nylon frame and through-hardened slide in either a brushed stainless or black nitride finish. State compliant variations are available where necessary and ship with two 10-round magazines.

Just like the original, full-sized SR9, the SR9c is loaded with modern safety features like a 1911-style ambidextrous manual safety, internal trigger bar interlock and striker blocker, trigger safety, magazine disconnect, plus a visual and tactile loaded chamber indicator.

title: For Sale:  Better-Than-New, Enhanced Glock 36 (retails new for $637 plus the cost of the mods); all original items are included, as well as the case.
postcontent:
COME TAKE this! A truly concealable Glock in a caliber that counts,  And, Glock is perfection!

This Glock has fired fired approximately 200 rounds--just enough to be correctly broken-in. It comes with the Top-of -the-Line Ghost 3.5-pound connector (installed), as well as the original 5.5-pound connector. The Glock barrel and feed-ramp are chrome-polished and  "MOLON LABE" is engraved on the barrel. It is gorgeous and has even improved function.

There is really no more-reliable, truly practical, concealed carry pistol than this beauty. The new Glock double recoil spring make this tremendous pistol so easy to control, and easy to  accurately place the critical first shot as well as follow-up shots.

Although bullet technology has made the 9 mm a much more useful self-defense round, the same technological improvements have been made in larger caliber rounds, including the 45 ACP. In terms of the per-shot effectiveness, there really is no comparison between current 9 mm and current 45 caliber rounds.

Less informed people say, ".40 Smith & Wesson is a great compromise caliber." That may be a correct statement for FULL-sized, heavier pistol. However, for smaller, more practical, concealed carry pistols, the .40 Smith & Wesson round is not particularly desirable. This is because the .40 caliber Smith & Wesson is an extremely high pressure round. In a shorter, lighter pistol, this leads to significantly increased "muzzle flip;" it makes the accurate placement of follow-up shots more difficult and time-consuming. The recoil from a 45 caliber pistol is more of a push backwards than an upward snap; effective follow-up shots are easier.

In terms of rounds count, the Glock 36 holds seven rounds, including one in the chamber. There are those who talk about the importance of higher rounds count. FBI statistics show the number of rounds fired in self-defense situations to be far less than seven-even when dealing with multiple attackers. As an NRA instructor, I enlighten my students that there is a balance between concealability, lighter weight and comfort versus a less concealable, larger, heavier pistol with more rounds. A self-defense pistol is one that you want to wear every day. A larger, heavier and bulkier one will, even subconsciously, deter you from carrying it every day.

If a person is truly concerned about rounds count for some poorly guided reason, he should consider carrying the spare magazine. I carry a spare with a Pierce +2 extension in a particular pocket of my cargo pants. The combination of the loaded pistol and the second magazine is far more comfortable and less conspicuous. It also gives me nine more rounds, for a total of 16. That, in the opinion of many, may be significant and unnecessary overkill!

title: For Sale:  1000rds Israeli M855 5.56x45mm - Some Dented/Oxodized
location: Zion, NE Lake County, Chicago, Illinois
postcontent:
I have 1000 rounds of Israeli M855 5.56x45mm.  A lot of it is good to go, but after counting out 500 there's about 25 to 40 that are either dented or oxodized due to being exposed to the elements then repackaged.

Headstamps are IMI (Commercial Israeli M855)/TZ (Actual military issue M855).  Most of the dented/oxodized are TZ headstamped, meaning they were probably issued to soldiers then put back in the ammo pile.  Dated around 93-98. 

About 475 of it is packaged in zip-lock bags, 25 of the "bad" rounds are also zip locked.  The remaining 500 is loose in an ammo can.

I CANNOT GUARANTEE PERFORMANCE DUE TO DENTS AND OXODIZING.  I've asked around and many of those who I have asked (which put thousands of 5.56 rounds downrange each year) said it looks fine.  Either way, I don't want it anymore.

FTF ONLY in NE Illinois... Zion, Waukegan, Gurnee area. Or Pleasant Prairie WI. Must have FOID card or WI ID.

title: For Sale:  Ruger Blackhawk 45 Colt/45 ACP
postcontent: Stainless steel Ruger Blackhawk comes with two cylinders so it can shoot both 45 colt and 45 ACP. Has a few small scratches if you look close enough, but overall a great looking gun. It is also a very rare Blackhawk, the stainless steel version of the .45 convertible with the 4-5/8" barrel. While the blue convertible BN44X models are fairly common, there were only 537 of the stainless KBN44X models made and shipped to Davidson's in the early 1990's. Production was scattered through the serial number range 47-40974 to 47-62202. Most of the stainless 4-5/8" guns you see are .45 Colt only. Never a cataloged model. These don't come up for sale very often.This model can shoot all the high powered heavy loads that most others can't.
